column2: KANSAS DMV TEST
Question Text
1. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
2. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 3. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 4. Stopping distances:
column6: are not affected by vehicle speed.

column2: 5. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 6. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column6: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 7. This yellow sign means:
8. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column8: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

column2: 9. When changing lanes, drivers should identify a ____ second gap in traffic.
10. This sign means:
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 11. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
column6: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
column8: slow down to allow traffic to enter.

column2: 14. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column6: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.
column8: Swerve into the lane next to you.

column2: 15. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 16. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
17. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. This road sign means:
20. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 21. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: You must travel at the speed indicated
column6: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions

column2: 23. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
column6: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.

column2: 24. Safety belts:
column4: should not be worn if your vehicle is equipped with air bags.
column6: must be worn at all times.
column8: should not be worn when driving at slower speeds.
